I think I know what caused this problem is that the restaurant seems to have a lot of young kids working. An adult did approach me to try to coax me back, but it was clear that the rest of the staff in the restaurant didn't want to serve me so I didn't feel welcome to come back. Moral to the story, don't ever come here anytime near closing.

rrD8GfZk_VOLKQKZsHIsOg.text: Definitely a more pricey place for Oakland, but I've never had bad food or service there. I would definitely recommend the side of potatoes. Also, the pizzas are really good. It's a good place for a date, a group of friends to catch up, or grabbing a drink with a friend. THEY DON'T TAKE RESERVATIONS so if you are trying to go there with a big party there is an app you can use to reserve a table like 30 minutes before you get there. Also I think you can just call ahead, but only like 30 minutes ahead. I think.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

jEQ5dbn93avhtg3LXPDXhQ.text: We visited the restaurant for the first time to meet a great Friend.  Parking wasn't too bad - but I would advise a little extra time to look for street parking.  It was lunchtime on a Saturday and pretty crowded.  We were told our wait was 10-15 minutes which wasn't bad. There's a small counter if you don't want a table which was nice.   The restaurant is a lot bigger inside than it looks outside.. plenty of seating.  We were seated in about 10 minutes.  The menu (brunch) was small - but don't feel it was limited.. it was just right.  There was something on there for everyone - especially my picky boyfriend.  I ordered the chicken blt with side of crispy taters and a margarita pizza for us to share.   The pizza came first and I really love how it was served. .on a oven square pan with cheese, red pepper flakes and oregano (think it was that spice).  What a clever way of serving this delicious pizza.   Ok -now this pizza was pretty delicious.. one of the best I have had and disappeared quickly.. everyone at my table agreed.   The chicken blt sandwich was perfect (so fresh!) and accompanied by "crispy taters" which were interesting.. little chucks of potatoes cooked until golden brown - were quite good.    Despite the restaurant was quite busy our service was excellent. I look forward to returning and sitting outside.  Definitely a great first experience. Thanks to "the porch".

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. margarita pizza
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. buffalo chicken ranch pizza
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken blt

YJS3YVY6VaUkg1S2AJES_g.text: Decent brunch spot! Came here at 11am on a Sunday and luckily got a table without any wait. Shortly after I arrived there was already a line of people though so it seems to get pretty busy. I ordered the sausage and eggs and everyone at my table got an assortment of different things - ranging from burger, omelette, pizza, and sandwich. Everything that came out looked good and was a pretty big portion. The pizza was pretty large and can definitely be shared for a cheap brunch option! My sausage and eggs was good - came with really good toast, hash brown, and greens! Very happy with the variety I got on my plate.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sausage and eggs - a lot is hiding under the greens but trust me this is a good amount of food

ULz5cdkH_IVksjmNz_ZQkw.text: The Porch is a great lunch spot in Oakland, especially on a nice, sunny day. Their outdoor seating is inviting and a great place to people watch. They are known for their pizzas, served with spices on the side, but their salads and local draft and craft cocktail selections are not to be missed! I opted for the harvest salad with pulled chicken, but my boyfriend's supreme pizza was the clear winner. The Porch is a great spot for lunch because of their speedy service. I was also a big fan of their selection of fresh, infused waters!

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Supreme pizza
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Harvest salad with pulled chicken

ipHRu-xvsR_2i4P-eJ7wDw.text: The porch has been a very big hit or miss experience for me. I have been there on three separate occasions in the past three years.   The first time I went was as a freshman and I was thoroughly impressed when I ordered the Bianca pizza.  The somewhat unique combination of fig sauce topped with arugula was surprisingly delicious and exceeded my expectations. I went with a large party and they were very accommodating.   However, the second time I went with my significant other as a sophomore, I decided to order a "prime rib" sandwich and an apple based dessert. The prime rib sandwich was very disappointing with over cooked and dried beef and the dessert was simply awful. It looked like an attempt at the cobbler but ended up tasting like crumbs and dough tossed lazily on apples.  Oddly, enough I went back as junior with a couple of friends and had a very mixed experience. I personally ordered the prime rib and was completely satisfied with how it was cooked and it tasted delicious. However, my roommate ordered the seafood hot pot and was left disappointed with the portion size. Luckily, the staff was very accommodating and was able to give my roommate a replacement dish that was very filling. The wait was a bit long overall though.   Overall, the porch is located in a convenient place, but the quality of their food items really does vary from dish to dish.

SqwNcarQYiVcRjnnEB3LDA.text: My dad and I went here before a show at the Carnegie Music Hall nearby. It was a gift for him. We allowed ourselves nearly 2 hours to eat, expecting there to be some sort of wait, prior to the show. We did wait the majority of the 2 hours and had 15 minutes to eat. It was my dad's first time there and he kept asking if the service is usually this bad. It seemed they were underprepared for the weekend rush. I felt really bad that ended up being the "main event" of the night, rather than the show.  With that being said, I've never had food that wasn't good here! The pizzas are great and there's so unique options as well. My dad got a pizza with crab on it which was wonderful! I opted for the margherita pizza which is tasty as well! This was also the first time I had a bad experience here with service. The waitress was delightful but we could tell she was stressed and overwhelmed, despite working there several years, she said. I might also add, parking usually is not good. There's limited on-street parking but it's usually filled up. I hope this unique dining spot is able to turn things around!

NUBgaYiJo7dFsqmjc0GsmQ.text: I ordered the chili and cheesy bread and my husband got the prime rib sandwich. Despite the chili being a little salty and the dough being undercooked, everything was really good. I love the decor and outdoor seating area.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Turkey chili
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Breadsticks
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Prime rib sandwich

OqLDaAB2ZY1JQsEcGlW0vQ.text: This was my first time coming here for brunch! Normally I just come for half off pizzas in their late night deal. Arriving at around 11:40 we were seated immediately and offered water. My friends all decided to order the ($14) Eggs Benedict while I stuck with their ($5) Cinnamon rolls. The food came after maybe 10-15 minutes. The portions were quite sizable, even for the cinnamon rolls.   Seeing that I ordered them, I can speak best about the rolls. They were presented in a cast iron pan and coated in cream cheese icing. They were very soft and at a nice temperature, but the edges also had a good crunch to them. They weren't overpoweringly sweet. Although I couldn't finish them, I did enjoy having them! I think they were very much worth their price and I'm glad I chose to try them. I would order them again if I were in the mood for some sugar.  I tried my friends' eggs benedict. This time they seemed to have chorizo as the meat. The bread underneath was still crunch and the salt of the chorizo complimented the flavor of the egg and bread well. The tater tots are just small potatoes on the side. It also tastes really good with the ketchup they give!   Overall I'm always satisfied after leaving the porch. It has a nice ambiance, an aesthetic inside and affordable prices for college students or those not looking to spend a fortune on food! I'm always down to come back!

NmlW9BRQ70v9THLcNwTl7Q.text: Went here with some friends and was pleasantly surprised. Our service was really quick and the food was fresh. I feel like there was ample options and I had a hard time choosing what I wanted.  It wasn't rock your socks off amazing but I had a enjoyable time and would come back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

DLB2_7nBbazIrHqGoFg-uQ.text: The restaurant was very busy on Saturday night after the Pitt basketball game. The host staff was rude. There weren't enough bussers as there were many dirty empty tables and no one being seated for quite a while! Our waitress was great though thank god! Very attentive! The food was really tasty. Spinach artichoke dip appetizer served with LOTS of crispy bread. The Porch burger  was excellent and rosemary potatoes were good! I would visit the Porch again but not on such a busy night after a big game.

2WD-KJWm2A5BDLEU8wjrJg.text: Stopped in for a quick bite before a performance at Pitt. Had a seat at the bar and ordered this amazing seasonal pizza with roasted squash. Crust was perfect- loved the presentation, service was great and the wine paired nicely. Can't wait to return!

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

3H0WWG7eKDtyX232KFQm9w.text: Ok I know what people are going to say: How could you give The Porch only 3 stars!  Went here for brunch today and the meal had two sides the really good and the bad.   What we sampled:   Farm Bread with honey butter, apple butter, and blueberry preserves            Today's farm bread was homemade english muffins and the order came with 2 whole english muffins.  The muffins were delicious especially enhanced with the different butters and preserves.   Bianca Pizza: Fig Jam, Goat Cheese, Mozzarella, Arugula, Truffle oil             This was my order, and I was pretty disappointed. I love all of the things that this pizza promised, but I don't think that it delivered. Overall the pizza had way to much fig jam and the taste was overwhelming and I wasn't able to taste the other flavors.   Burger: Roasted Red Peppers, Caramelizied Onions, and a Fried Egg on a Brioche Bun              This burger was awesome!  The burger was cooked rare though we requested medium rare, but it was so good it didn't matter.  Also the egg was perfectly cooked.  This was messy and delicious in all the right ways.   Cast iron pork belly              Possibly the most disappointing dish of all.  It was a small cast iron skillet with 10 small chunks of pork belly that were so overcooked they were almost impossible to eat.   I would probably return for dinner to see what they are able to do, but I don't know about brunch.   The service was good and our waitress fulfilled every request that we had. The place was bustling with small and large groups and the noise level was moderate.  I also liked the decor and the towels for napkins.

cpRNxNyHdJQWn3QEQ0YHTw.text: I live in Oakland and therefore visit The Porch frequently.  Every time I go I order the pizza because it's the most reasonably priced item on the menu.  My favorite is the BBQ pizza because it's hearty and a perfect balance between sweet and spicy.  The margarita pizza is also amazing and one of the best margarita pizzas I've ever had.  One complaint is that the pizza sizes are inconsistent depending on the day and who is working.  Last month a bunch of friends and I went and all the pizzas were burnt but I just went last week and they were cooked perfectly.

2htyd2vGfjwAlhF6Oe6TSg.text: I went to The Porch for dinner and had a veggie burger. It was pretty delicious and the portion was very large. What I like most about The Porch is the atmosphere. Living in South Oakland makes me forget what fine dining feels like, while The Porch isn't exactly fine dining, it is a pretty place to go on a date or bring your family from out of town. It is in an awesome location with the Cathedral of Learning right across the street and Schenley plaza to one side. I love this place and can't wait to go again.

xASNsGaL_37AZNU7FSVQxg.text: So amazing!! My boyfriend and I came here for lunch and had such a good experience. The beer and wine selection was pretty good. We shared the garden salad and Bianca pizza...both UNREAL. The Bianca was one of the best pizzas I have ever had. The waitress was really friendly and all of the other employees were helpful. I will 100% be back next time I'm in Pittsburgh!!

cMaQ2Q3srOXM7Wd3abTBPg.text: We went to The Porch this past Saturday and the food was delicious. My wife had never been to The Porch before so the waitress was explaining that the food was mainly organic or natural food with the exception to their water. She said the water is not organic but it is locally sourced and 100% guaranteed to contain water molecules previously drank by Julius Caesar. Which sounds awesome; unless you grew up in the British education system. Which is why my wife asked me if Julius Caesar was a famous US President. We started off with the cast iron cornbread and scallops. Both tasted good. We especially liked the honey butter with the cornbread. The scallops came with risotto and some type of nut in a spicy red sauce. I couldn't quite determine what was in the red sauce, but it tasted so good. For the entrees, we had the Filet Mignon and Salmon. The filet was wrapped in bacon and perfectly cooked. I personally don't like broccoli rabe. I don't know why people like broccoli rabe so much. I always feel like I am getting cheated out of the good broccoli parts. I also didn't like the Violet Mustard sauce under the filet that much. I would really like to try a blue cheese sauce with some sort of alcohol in it.  The salmon and all of the side dishes were delicious. The skin on the salmon was nice and crispy. I have never been able to get the salmon skin this crispy at home and don't know how hard it is for a trained chef, but most places don't nail this dish the way The Porch nailed this dish. This dish was put together and cooked so well, that there is nothing to improve on with this dish. If you like salmon, this is a wondrous dish.  We will definitely be back soon.

XBJXfZE61UKkj2gL_dxaUA.text: I was alone. As I sometimes am. And this place was in the perfect location, with the perfect way to purchase, with a great selection of seating during lunchtime. I was so afraid i'd have to deal with a waiter or get something super fancy. But low and behold this simple but diverse menu of good, fresh food. And I had a very delicious take on a veggie burger. Obviously this was made in house. Sit outside if possible, request a bottle of water, and enjoy your slow afternoon.

mJYsroX816qqN8bMin_zBw.text: Soup dugout was Mac and cheese soup- very tasty, the cornbread was a delicious hit, the burger juicy, with pulled short rib meat atop and blue cheese within. The crunchy potatoes were perfect, curry ketchup to dip.  The draft beer choices were all tempting, but the Four Seasons stout was a complex thrill! Fresh, hot donuts  were shared to cap the meal.  First time won't be last time.

3MrxE_epB2mXs9q8ScKqXQ.text: Went for brunch. Nice location/interior but service was average and food was overpriced. Food tasted good but then again it's hard to screw up pancakes. Not my favorite restaurant but not bad. All around average.

AtZdcp5Bq380YTkAYNtguw.text: The wait to get seated and get food is usually 20~40 minutes, but it's worth it when the food is served. I ordered the duck confit once, but I wasn't the biggest fan. It was too salty and a bit overpriced for its size. I do recommend the pizzas though! They come out on a tin tray with different seasonings and it's pretty cool!

YRUEHEp40i5wQgOXS0kTWw.text: Good food especially pizza. Go for happy hour as it is pricey. Also go in the summer when the windows open up.

JjcvdNm32LzZw6aRl6J0gw.text: After failing to get a table at reservations-required venues, and finding that many places were closed, I decided to bring my parents and brother to the Porch for Easter lunch. We arrived to a half-empty restaurant and sat down.  Our waiter, Brian, seemed awkward at first, but he was actually hilarious, and we all were laughing during much of our interactions.  We started out with an order of the Farm Bread--the honey butter and other two spreads that came with the bread were absolutely delicious. We almost ordered a second plate, but decided against it. I got the eggs benedict on special, which was...amazing. Prosciutto, arugula, and the most flavorful tomatoes I've ever eaten joined the perfectly cooked egg on top of a crispy English muffin.  My mom got the margherita pizza, which is something that usually doesn't excite me, but the presentation was adorable (little piles of cheese, peppers, and dried oregano) and the pizza itself was pretty great. I'm going to order one of the more adventurous pizzas next time.  Dad and brother both got the surf and turf special, which was filet and shrimp (not lobster, but the shrimp was seasoned and prepared excellently) atop garlic mashed taters and asparagus. I didn't sample theirs, but they were both very happy with the meal.  Best part? Before tax, our bill was only $80. Dad and I got a beer each (East End Big Hop ftw!), and brother got a housemade peach berry soda. Not bad for a wonderful lunch for four, if you ask me. My only worry about this place is the emptiness--it's great that I can walk in and sit down without a wait even on one of the busiest dining days, but more people need to find out about this place so it can stick around. Go to the Porch!

Q_NnoaMD1xoRyWGRLW10QQ.text: Although I loved the decor, I wasn't terribly impressed with the food.  My boyfriend and I had wandered over to Schenley Plaza to get a relatively cheap lunch at the Chinese stand, but we found it was still closed for the season.  So we decided to give The Porch a try.   We each had a pizza - I had the margherita pizza and he had the bolognese.  The flavor was good but they were overcooked and oily.  The pieces literally fell apart as we tried to pick them up off of the cookie sheet.  We had to flag our waitress down anytime we needed something (i.e. drink refills, the check) because she paid no attention at all to the tables.  When we asked for a to go box she brought us one small box that we had to stuff the leftovers in, which left us with a box stuffed with deformed, mushy pizza.    I would be satisfied with The Porch if it were at the right price - for what we got, it was definitely not worth it.

0-wEqR7HaV7j7Bff0k2AFA.text: First off, I loved the atmosphere and layout of this restaurant so much that I knew I would be coming back again and again!   I ordered pretty boring things, so I don't feel it's fair for me to rate the food entirely. I did try my friend's dishes and really enjoyed the duck as well as the roast beef sandwich. I was also a big fan of their crispy taters!   I'll definitely be back again!

Q8W3kAKiHgrOsqPaMSyYFA.text: Always a friendly atmosphere and great food and drink. Fun in the summer and a great place to meet friends.  We have always had a good meal here and the staff really seem to care about their customers. Everyone is busy and keeps the place moving at a brisk pace. You can call ahead and get on a waiting list. We had Mimosas and quiche today on crisp Pittsburgh day. It was great!

M0QFUY44kVQXjS3A-vIRHg.text: I really wanted to love this place but I didn't. The food was just ok and under-seasoned for my tastes. I went with some friends for brunch and everything sounded really good. They had daily specials that all sounded really good. I ended up getting the crab scramble. It was basically scrambled eggs, asparagus, and crab meat. The eggs were still runny when I got the dish which I was ok with but it seemed like something that I could have done on my own. It did come with potatoes which were also pretty tasty but they had fennel in them this day. Fennel is kind of an odd spice for me. It was not my favorite with the potatoes.  After going for brunch, I was intrigued by the Bianca pizza with goat cheese, fig jam, and arugula. A friend had gotten me onto having arugula on pizza and I wanted to try this one. It was just alright. I'm not a huge fan of goat cheese but It didn't have enough goat cheese or fig jam to pair well with the arugula. Aside from the arugula, the pizza was too mild for me. I had made my own pizza with goat cheese, caramelized onions, and prosciutto that came out way better than this pizza at The Porch. I will say that the dough was very well made.

xx_mj6bN_bJFPAgQCWS7xg.text: I ordered a lentil soup and grilled cheese.  The food tasted quite good.  I disliked how the water was served - a cooler by the cash registers, so it's disruptive to keep getting up and refilling the glass.  Recommended, price is about $10/entree.

bZDnBtC8qpaASZdPqzv_NA.text: Nut Allergy friendly  Son had the Chicken: nice roasted chicken.  savory, tasty pickled peppers and cured tomatoes added a lot of character to the dish.  Wake you up, yummy flavors.  I had the salmon special.  Lovely cooked, yellow raisins and roasted peppers added a sweet and salty and satisfying note to the fish.    Friend had the veggie burger.  She was pleased.  We had all sorts of food allergies in the party.  But the server went over things multiple time of her OWN ACCORD to get the allergies right.  The kitchen accommodated.  The lady server was very kind.    We have a lovely, wonderful time!!!

B1qG55NECPO8psYd3TwFUA.text: Great atmosphere, a great prime rib sandwich, and outstanding service from our waiter, Christopher! Not our first time here, and definitely won't be our last.

nnBLGXTOdly4e3OELC-3Mw.text: This is what I call a hidden gem!  Located right next to Pitt Hillman Library, the Porch is not very popular among student population. To me, a restaurant next door to library simply doesn't sounds appealing at all. That said, I finally gave it a try, and turns out I'm totally like it! The menu is not very extensive, but full of innovative dishes. Get their pizza! I've tried BIanca and Winter Harvest, and both are good! The portion size is quite big, and I ended up boxing 2/3 of my foods one day when I went there alone. The service is good, fast and friendly. I have nothing against this place.

oX3GXMDmzqeM3ajmrYIBEw.text: We enjoyed the atmosphere (semi outdoor dining) and the sustainable ecosystem here.  They grow their own produce and have a behive on the roof to pollinate their own plants!  I loved the organic feeling of it all.  We tried several items: pizza appetizer (yum), Lake Erie Grouper (yum), veggie burger (decent).  The drinks were unique.  I didn't enjoy the Pink Lemonade cocktail - the description led me to believe there would be pureed raspberries but the drink tasted poor and syrupy.  I also tried the gin and tonic and found the gin to be too zingy for my taste (something local, I believe).  Beers were consistent.  This is a great location, a cool vibe, but the drinks and food were fine, just nothing above average.

YuG3zkiUH0Bqad-LMXxc6Q.text: I found myself underwhelmed by this restaurant after 3 visits.   Like: beautiful space, very nice bar, some food pretty tasty-notably their pizzas are quite good.   Dislike: value is not good- I always feel like I did not get what I paid for when I leave, shrimp and grits were underwhelming to be kind (small portion, under salted, and not so tasty shrimp that I'm sure came frozen of a Sysco truck), and the drink prices are outrageous. Take rumors however you want, but we heard that they keep drink prices high because the typical clientele don't care, and they want to keep the college (legal) drinking crowd out of their bar.   There are better options for my dining dollar in Pittsburgh's wonderfully dynamic food scene.

Yij8S9aYP0w_IlgrhuMoZA.text: Going through my reviews, you'll see a lot of reviews for Oakland lunch places. With a standing Friday lunch with a few other friends, we have all of our favorites and also try new places too.  The Porch is a DEFINITE favorite. With gorgeous outdoor seating for spring and summer with an outdoor fireplace for the fall weather, the atmosphere at The Porch is great. On top of that, the food is always en pointe.  Having been here SOOO many times and trying to get something different each time (which is easy because their menu is seasonal and rotating), I can speak to a large section of their menu.  Pizzas: Great to share with a friend, but they're so delicious you could almost eat a whole one on your own!  Burgers: Large and juicy with interesting ingredients to give your palette an interesting punch to the tongue on a normal lunch option.  Sides: Choosing between the side salad and the taters is hard because the salad is a great mix of arugula and spring greens with a light dressing that freshens your tastebuds while the taters are perfect fried crispy golden-ness with a spicy/curry ketchup.  Entrees: These change all of the time and oh man have I had some great ones! My favorite to this day is the Chile Verde with cilantro sour cream. Holy moley this was SO good! On my last trip there I had the brisket gnocchi. While I'm not a big gnocchi fan, I LOVED the brisket/sauce it came in.  Beers: Though it is a bit hard to order because there isn't a list right at the front and you have to go to the side to see the taps (though I think they may now have a list when you walk in the door), they have a well thought out selection of rotating and seasonal beers. It's not one of those annoying places that only has one type (sigh IPAs...), but instead always has a variety of options ranging from anything from stouts, to irish reds, to pilsners, to yes - IPAs, to more. They even had their own beer brewed by B2 from the honey from their bees on the rooftop.  I could talk for so much longer about the porch, so I won't because I hope you've gotten the impression now that this is a YES on your stop in schenley plaza.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gnocchi with brisket

3D7O08BMEHX_Xq6Gn4EzNA.text: Nice location near my hotel. Was able to sit outside because the weather was beautiful, so that was nice. The food selection was smaller than I had hoped, so I was forced to order something I normally don't get. The drinks were brought out rather quickly, but they just weren't very strong. Probably would give this place another chance, especially with nice weather.

QmZCY3J7gA2OjDmQIjq8UQ.text: Tonight was the second experience my family and I had at the porch and it was great. The staff is extremely kind and genuine. We ordered the vegetarian wings which are made of "chicken in the woods" mushrooms. Our server was excited that we ordered them because the chef loves to make them. He even came out and served them to us himself and took the time to explain what goes in to collecting the mushrooms. We also love that everything is organic. The food is unique and very good quality. We all ordered something different and all was delicious. We ended with tiramisu and a chocolate parfait. I highly recommend this restaurant and will be back soon!

zj5drIPFLh49nrYjiGOsMA.text: Two is gracious   1. The service is bland - no personality  - waited 10 to 15 for our drinks  - placed app order - they were out of that specific app  - ordered muscles, took one bite and had to use my napkin to spit it out. Fishy and gritty - told the server we were unhappy and he just said ok, so you are finished with these ? Yes, because they are bad. - had to ask for plates and forks to attempt to eat these monstrosities.  - ordered dinner - dinner arrived, had to ask for forks again  -$72.00 later when we finally got the check - we put $100 in cash down and he asked  if we needed change. Yes, because we are not leaving you a $28 tip for ok service ...  - pizza was good   Peeps - don't waste your time on this place...

o2nWpzUvSXIkZUtl5Vcy2A.text: Overall, the service, employees, and food was good, but it wasn't outstanding. We had to wait around 45min for a table for 4 (we went on a Saturday night around 6:30). Our waiter was very friendly and helpful. The menu selection is on the smaller side, so if you don't like a ton of choices, this is the restaurant for you! My pizza (Italian) was good, but not super memorable.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. One side of the menu
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. L&#39;Italiana Pizza
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rotisserie chicken

6UB_kGB_h9zuOGApNHEksA.text: Best place on campus to bring parents. Food is quality and the servers are very efficient. Also a good place to take someone on a date before going to Phipps!

4Uj1q3MIcGMcXEMC96zwWw.text: It's fancy! Place was packed but we were seated fairly quickly and the service was good and the food was yummy.  I think they must deep fry the potatoes but mmm I don't care, sooo good!  I had eggs benedict and my wife one of their pizza's.  We enjoyed both thoroughly.  Prices were reasonable, I'll definitely be back.

Zl_IJnfq0emhkbCpuulanQ.text: I really wanted to give this place a five star review! But I just can't.  I work in Oakland and The Porch is usually where we go for work lunch meetings, since it's one of the only sit down restaurants in Oakland. I've been a few times, and my experience is always similar.  The food is definitely good, and different. I'm a vegetarian, and I've sampled their veggie burger, pizzas, and grilled cheese - all are delicious. They also have great lunch specials. They have a nice selection of beers as well.  I love the outdoor seating area, especially when the weather is nice. If I am looking to go to a happy hour after work and it's nice outside, I will pick The Porch every time.  What holds me back from five stars is the service and the price. I think they are a tad overpriced, especially for what you get in return. But the service every time I have been here has been pretty lackluster. I've never had a great service experience, which is disappointing, given all the other great things about The Porch.  I will continue to go because of the quality and location, but I do hope that I will see an improvement in the quality of service provided.

-myw2F343sgumY92cRX2vQ.text: I've eaten at the Porch twice.  The first time, there was a fly problem.  Dozens of big black flies that kept buzzing around our table and crashing into windows.  It was sort of insane to me that they would allow this happen and not take immediate action to get the flies under control.    A year later, we decide to give it another chance.  Almost every single table we tried to sit at was dirty.  We went outside, also all dirty.  We chose the least dirty table.  The water came in jars.  Every single jar had little specks of food stuck to the inside of the glass.  I asked for the bartender to fill a glass of water, and the employees acknowledged that the jars were dirty but said they were simultaneously "fine" to drink from.  When I got to my table, I realized the cup they had given me was dirty.  Maybe their dishwasher isn't cleaning well?  Our food was delivered without plates, napkins, silverware.  At our request, our server went to get some, put down two napkins (there were 3 of us) and left.  I don't know if we were supposed to get our own.  It wasn't clear during the ordering process.    I liked the food both times.  I wish I enjoyed the dining experience.  Won't be back.

iT0RtRfsvBKU2SavwDw5tg.text: Very enjoyable place to have a classier meal than your standard college fare, even though it's right in the middle of CMU and UPitt. The inside is very clean, yet rustic and whenever I walk in it gives me a really happy feeling.  Make sure you come here on weekdays after 9pm for half-off pizzas! Their menu often changes with the season, but in the Fall get their Butternut Squash Pizza. The sweetness of the squash goes great with the cheese. The crust of all their pizzas are always crispy and they give you three little piles of toppings: parmesan cheese, herbs, chili peppers.  If you are a carnivore I recommend getting the Piggie Pie. It's covered with bacon, sausage, ham, etc. I find it a little bit too salty for my taste though.  Some of the dishes I ordered here are no longer on the menu because their menu changes seasonally, but here are some of the permanent sides and appetizers I recommend:  Cornbread - I love love love their cast-iron cornbread. It's one of the most savory, buttery, delicious corn bread I've ever had. They put real corn in it and it comes out piping hot. The top of it is crispy unlike normal cornbread. My favorite appetizer here.  Crispy Taters - Another thing worth trying are their roast potatoes. It's full of herbs and comes with a delicious curried ketchup.  For the entrees, go for the more expensive/classier dishes like the duck. My friend who's ordered the ribeye there once said it wasn't cooked right and later he felt sick after eating it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork Belly Sandwich and Tater Tots with Curried Ketchup

UybMyfHVVJ4MMlM87CSN8w.text: Living in Oakland, I almost think of The Porch as my own back porch... but with food. It's right there if I need it for a big occasion, but it was just as good on a dinner date. They have food, drinks, and happy hour for both drinks and food (I think their pizza is half off M-Fri after 9PM). Two reasons that set this place apart for me are:  1. It's great for large groups. There's a lot of space available, as well as a pretty diverse menu so you can satisfy most of your group.  2. It's reliable. When our original brunch choice was closed for a wedding shower, we got a table for 11 at the Porch with no problems.   I think their servers are friendly, and the food has been consistently tasty. Usually when I go, I struggle with picking just one option because everything on the menu sounds delicious. I legitimately worry about missing out on my second choice.   The last time I went was for brunch, and there was just too much I wanted to eat. One of their specials that weekend was a skillet full of three warm cinnamon buns, drizzled with cream cheese glaze. Perfect for splitting and so homey. I ended up getting their yogurt with granola and stone fruit, and it was light and flavorful.   The prices are not cheap, but they're reasonable. This is definitely one of the nicer places in Oakland. I really like that they have daily specials to change up the menu, and maybe I'll get to try some in the future. Four and a half stars!

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. skillet with three cream cheese glazed cinnamon rolls
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. vanilla bean yogurt with cinnamon spiced granola, honey, and stone fruit

V8ShwPiaTajdwqOZhGimHg.text: Ok so first, they denied a vet with a service dog to sit OUTSIDE (major fail!)stating he could order to go and sit in the park seats; it wasn't until we explained that the ADA allows service animals.   They cleared a table for us and then sat someone else at our table (mix ups happen, so we gave a pass)...they sit us, after 10 minutes our waiter comes and takes our appetizer order...10 minutes later takes our entree order (not, although they had a wedding party, the restaurant really wasn't busy.  There were 3 tables that sat after us.....well, the ordered, ate, and left all before we got our entree.  So after 55 mins of waiting and me getting walking in to ask for our check, they FINALLY have our food....the manager apologized and offered us a  to go box....as for the food, I had the Scottish salmon, the rest in my party had pizzas....the collective opinion on our lukewarm food was it'll make a turd.  Food was just mediocre a best, would've gave 3-stars, however after the service a one star is generous!

zxJZfwpWt4cQ4nPjbQycwg.text: 1. Seating is decent 2. Portions are small, specially Salmon. Was done very well and tasted well, was also presented beautifully. It was a visual delight 3. Soup was good my first Spicy Squash Soup and I happily lived through it. 4. Desserts were awesome, my kids loved their take on Creme Brulee  5. I can go back here.  I won't mind paying 10% more for a 20% bigger portion.

aJ1wUjRZdxP1_JOlLALr3w.text: I am a huge fan of The Porch.   1. They are on NoWait. Just hope in line before you leave the house, and you're seated when you get there.  2. The crispy potatoes are to die for.   3. The pizzas are delicious.  Honestly, I've never had a bad experience here. The staff is great. The food is served quickly.   It's great for lunch or dinner.

s0Hm4Y6RDsChrSeE5FHP_g.text: I've been to the porch dozens of times over the last few years, even twice in one day sometimes, and not one of my experiences has ever disappointed me. Brunch is always cooked perfectly and never too crowded, so food comes in a timely manner. If you're on the run during the week the breakfast sandwiches and $1 coffee window are amazing! The pancakes are breakfast burger are favorites if you sit down.   The nice thing about the porch isn't just the fresh ingredients but the seasonal rotation of foods. They do a good job of providing different things at different times of the year to satisfy every craving. The pizzas in particular vary year round. The piggie pie in the fall and winter is particularly delicious. A year round staple that I highly recommend is the prime rib sandwich but it's almost always worth it to try one of the specials if they sound intriguing to you. My best luck with specials was when I had tacos. The veggie burger is also always fresh and hearty but the potatoes that come with it are amazing.   Dessert at the porch is always delicious too, ask about the gelato flavors. The only big complaint I have is the draft selection. I can find some rare drafts there but there's typically not much to choose from. The wine selection pairs well with most of the food but with the pizza id usually like a draft. Mixed drinks are stronger than at most places though which is great. All in all the porch is always a good idea.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brunch donuts
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

YsmYnyLY8J1MAwmbmnCACg.text: Although we had to bogart our seats and create our own 7 person table, this place was great! The complimentary cornbread was fantastic. The wings are served naked with sauce on the side but trust me even if you prefer sauce on your wings, you will love these wings. The ribs were better than good but not amazing. I had the pasta of the day which was a homemade and wonderful. The service was definitely five star so if I could have given it a 4.5, I would.

XrLYkj_T9ADuWYx9eNWvsg.text: Went for brunch.  Beautiful place. Great atmosphere. Great menu. Great coffee. Reasonably priced.   I like when a place says something is spicy and delivers. The red chilis in the omelette were perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken and biscuits with sausage gravy that took me back to Nashville.

FWjhhygALfpyY90EYWiuPA.text: We are a late breakfast/brunch here. All I can say is don't order the Eggs Benedict. One egg cooked correctly the other solid center which I could live with, but the meat used in this dish over powered all the subtle tastes of the hollandaise sauce and eggs. The meat would be better served in tacos or a burrito. I would order the potatoes, I asked for extra crispy. These are small red or white potatoes more like smashed potatoes than hashed and flavored with rosemary, salt, and pepper.

NfQLYuNjHN30CkhHl2o8sg.text: I've been to The Porch at Schenley a couple times for brunch and have tried their eggs benedict as well as their chicken and waffles. Both times I was more than happy with the way my food tasted, but I found the service to be somewhat slow. I would have to argue, though, that the wait was worth it for the quality of my food. The absolutely delicious (and insta-worthy) cinnamon rolls we ordered as an appetizer definitely helped smooth out our wait.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

mhX93iY27iBtxf3k47ctnA.text: My friend and I stopped here for brunch on Sunday yesterday 8/11/19 and it was my first time here. I would say the only cons that we experienced were that it can be difficult to find parking and our waitress wasn't very attentive to our table (however I wouldn't penalize a rating for one person). They also ran out of almond milk so that sort of stunk for the drinks we initially wanted.  We sat outside and were seated right away, just beat the rush as it soon became busy. We were very hungry: ordered the cinnamon roll as an appetizer to split, the breakfast pizza to split, the eggs benedict with shrimp, and the burrito (mostly pictured in my added photos to this review). They were all quite delicious however the portions are pretty large for me and we had a lot of leftovers. The pizza wasn't my favorite but it was different. The burrito I ate the other half for breakfast the next day (today!).  I didn't take a photo of the menu, regrettably, but I thought it was sort of limited for breakfast/lunch however the restaurant isn't all that big either so it is expected. I really like the location despite the parking issue as you're in the center of Pitt's campus and it is just a beautiful location to sit outside and get a nice view of Oakland/enjoy the outdoor area. I would go again to try more options! The prices are reasonable and everyone there seemed pleasant.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

MuS13H0SG3lHIxCzHYU3Xw.text: Seemed like a nice place and was close to where I was staying, so decided to give it a try.   The food all looked pretty good, but we were just walking around and wanted a night cap.   Ordered an old fashioned, but I was unaware that Pittsburgh used maple syrup at times instead of turbinado or simple syrup. Also, the bourbon used had a lot of smoke and peat flavors that was closer to a scotch.   For atmosphere, will return to hang out with people. But will probably get a beer next time

36nstT-AAZCKX7pCK1s-Cg.text: Tried both locations while in Pitt late July (the one near South Hills, and the one near Carnegie Mellon).  Both are good...but I prefered the energetic vibe of the in town spot near Carnegie.    Happy hour is lively.  Pizza, spinach dip, brussell spouts...all good.  Service was spotty, and our tables werent very clean.  Otherwise, good stop!

nCu4Oai3RODjGteAQ8QxEQ.text: I have been to this Porch location several times. The food is always good. I don't think I have ever ordered a bad meal. My 3 stars is based solely on the fact that it takes FOREVER to get your food. You order at the front, take a number and wait...and wait...and wait. Oy! Make sure you have a lot of time on your hands if you are coming here.  Yesterday I ordered a tuna melt with side salad. I seriously do not think it should take 25 to 30 minutes to come out??? But hey it was an excellent tuna melt so it made my time worth it.

pGO4dQdYRlyV4nc636-DoA.text: Located in the heart of Pitt's campus, this is a staple for any student or food connoisseur. They regularly update their menu, so there are always different options to choose from. The pizza is the best on campus with their unique flavors (last time I had squash on my pizza!).  The workers are always extremely nice and attentive to their tables. I love the decor, drinking out of mason jars, and the fact that they leave a bottle of water at the table. I always drink water fast, so being able to refill it myself is great!  Overall, a great restaurant for families, students on a budget, or a yummy date night!

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo Chicken Pizza
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Creme Brulee
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salmon Dinner

6s1q6Fry6SuHdAf8lta69A.text: The Porch has great options for any time of day and is an Oakland classic in my eyes. Their seasonal menu always has a new and exciting selection.   The breakfast window is one of the best deals in Oakland. The veggie breakfast sandwich on sourdough is awesome and very affordable. The only downside is that they are only open until 11.   Brunch is also delicious at The Porch. The potatoes are awesome, and the quiche of the day has been delicious in my experience.   Dinner is also great. The pizzas are delicious. The seasonal ratatouille pizza was my favorite, but the margarita pizza is also very good. The Porch has great salads, and the spinach artichoke dip is amazing. The grapefruit and sage gimlet is very flavorful and it is the perfect combination of bitter and sweet!   Service is great too - I have never had any issues and the waitstaff is very nice.

kF0cOl6asAQa_uvT4BtFhw.text: Located just outside if Schenley Park, this place is convenient from any direction. They have a great atmosphere that is kid friendly and multiple outdoor seating areas (some covered and some open sky). The food and service are always consistent, and they have a great drink menu of unique cocktails and craft beer and wine.   The Brussel Sprouts are a great appetizer!  For dinner, I recommend the Salmon, Veggie Burger, or one of their pizzas. This is a great, open floor plan with a fun vibe and atmosphere. Whether you are just looking for drinks with friends or a nice dinner, you definitely have to check this place out!

hkkG_mFvvfsquRmUYIuuAg.text: I've come to this place so many times and I've never been disappointed. Their pizzas and burgers are amazing and their brunch is worth going to.

iux34yecz5xrzbq5fCv8mA.text: Solid food, reasonable prices, vibrant and open space with lots of natural light, all with a nice view of the Carnegie museum and Cathedral of Learning. Also located within walking distance of theater (Stephen Foster) and Phipps conservatory.  Went here for lunch with a group of four and sat in a booth by the window for good sunlight. You order at a counter top right as you walk in the front door but food is brought to your table. Water is self-serve. This all gives it a casual vibe, good for small groups.  We all enjoyed our food--entrees ranged from good (grilled cheese with a nice green salad for $8, chicken/bacon sandwich with home fries, which were whole potatoes, for $11) to very good (crispy veggie burger for $10) to excellent (pizza). It seems like they are known for their pizzas and ours had a delicious thin crust and several toppings (I think it was a meat lovers). It also comes with a few garnishes neatly on the platter. Easily fed one person for lunch and three others tried a slice. All for $14 so a good deal.  The menu is very basic American fare, so if you want something ethnic this isn't your bet. We liked it though!

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pizza
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled cheese with side salad
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken bacon sandwich with side of home fries

45GrZYgkCrnSQYgO-d254g.text: So after a long day of walking the Phipps Conservatory grounds, my girl gang and I needed a watering hole and a hearty lunch. Surprisingly, this little area of the city doesn't seem to offer an abundance of highly rated hot spots (despite being in the heart of Pitt). But The Porch at Schenley proffered a cool name and what appeared to be an even cooler dining atmosphere.   Now, we almost turned on our heals as soon as we walked through the door. Upon entering the building we noticed the ever dreaded, walk-up window from which to order our meal. BLEH. Despite this setup's seeming rise in popularity, I utterly detest the fast casual feel. I am a foodie...a foodie that prefers the full dining out experience. I want the comfort and ease of taking my time to peruse the menu before being required to deliver my choices to the server. I want someone to fill my beverage and make sure that my table came adequately equipped with flatware and salt and pepper shakers. Call me a restaurant snob....or even maybe just lazy, but I like what I like.   But, as I relayed earlier, this area had few options. So we stayed. And I am certainly overjoyed that we did. We took a few minutes to glance over both the food and beverage menus before approaching the counter to place our order. We were given the customary table number and told to take a seat wherever we prefer...And let me just add that as we wound our way to our chosen table, we looked longingly at our fellow diner's plates. Everything looked so superb!  We orderd a little bit of everything so I am going to try to keep this short and sweet:   Margherita Pizza - Fun rustic plating, fresh grated parm (um,yes) and booming with flavor. Their pizza's are made in a large pizza oven and open flames make everything taste better, right?!  Fish & Chips - Fish was done to perfection as were the delectable, salty fries (cue drool). However, the fish to batter ratio was off. Far too much batter covered this flaky, delicious cod.   Grilled Chicken BLT w/ Crispy Potatoes - Perfectly grilled, packed with flavor....and OMG, the potatoes. If you give The Porch a try, GET THE POTATOES!  Sorbet (Rhubarb) - Amazing. Tart and sweet and the perfect consistency.   Zeppole - Honestly, a little disappointing. They were heavy, like they were made from a pizza or bread dough rather than your typical fritter dough.   Farm bread - Basic. I little flat in taste and texture. But the accompanying apple butter and raspberry jam were to die for.   All in all, The Porch is a tasty little joint in the middle of a quaint and quiet area. You can enjoy the local scenery while chowing down on some great food and booze that you didn't have to wait long for. So, should I find myself in the neighborhood again, I'll definitely be heading for The Porch....and you should too :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Zeppole w/ raspberry sauce

Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. GRILLED CHICKEN BLT -  Grilled Chicken, Avocado, Tomato, Lettuce, Bacon, Aïoli on Onion Baguette. Served w/ crispy taters with curry ketchup
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. FISH &amp; CHIPS -  Beer Battered Alaskan Cod, Fresh Cut Fries, Celery Root Remoulade &amp; Lemon

ZZRN_exG3k2GkG7_qGpPPA.text: If you're in Oakland looking for a nicer restaurant, The Porch is one of your best (and only) options. While I love their pizzas, the overall experience fell flat for me.   We arrived around 5:30 on a Saturday night and I was told the wait would be about 15 minutes. No worries! They take your number and call you which I like because you can step out of the restaurant if you wish. After getting out phone call, we were seated at these tiny high tops in the middle of the crowd of other people waiting. Our hostess even had to ask people to move in order to seat us. The stools were tiny and the table barely fit our two meals. We were constantly being bumped and grazed by people waiting for their table. It was also right by the door and on a 25 degree night, that was less than ideal. If they're going to use those tables, they need to make sure they're more separate from all the commotion.   I ordered their classic peach cocktail and the server told me they were out of the appropriate liquor, so I settled for red sangria. It was very sub par and lacked much flavor or spices. The star of the night was definitely the fall classic pizza I ordered, featuring butternut squash and caramelized onions. It was phenomenal. We ended with an apple crisp for dessert that was underwhelming. A lot of apple - no crisp. But I did enjoy that they feature Millie's vanilla ice cream on top.   Despite all the chaos, or server was extremely polite and attentive and I'd be willing to give this place another shot.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

PRhLPQDJtOQJOsUrv5syiA.text: I came here around 7:45pm on a Saturday night with a party of 9 and we only had to wait around 15 minutes. They don't take reservations, but we did call ahead to let them know we were on our way so that they could plan ahead with their seating. I got the Bianca pizza ($13) and my friends and I shared the Crispy Taters ($4), Crispy Brussel Sprouts ($9), and Porch Wings ($11).  The Bianca was so good! It is definitely more of a sweet pizza than a savory one, and all of the strong flavors somehow worked together so amazingly well! I highly recommend this to anyone who likes goat cheese, fig, arugula, truffle oil, or all 4 like I do!  Despite the simplicity of the Crispy Taters, I was blown away! The skin was perfectly crispy, inside perfectly softened, and the curried ketchup was the cherry on top.  The Crispy Brussel Sprouts and Porch Wings were just average. They hit it spot on for tasting like they're supposed to. However for the price, I did expect a little bit more of each, considering how much came with the Crispy Taters!  I would definitely come back and order a whole Crispy Taters just for myself and definitely the Bianca again! Especially since I forgot to take pictures this time around..

oOVViQv612XsyjjOaoMACw.text: This place has been going steadily downhill for a few years.  It's a great location and nice atmosphere if you can get a seat outside.   Last time I went, the food was served cold and special orders seemed to be a challenge if you're vegetarian.  Ended up with a veggie bagel that seemed a little overpriced- $10 for a bagel with cream cheese and a side of tasteless greens with no dressing. Won't be back until evidence of improvement.

rIi7IURaJ8Oub8tZrpHxNw.text: What an INCREDIBLE stop for brunch. The restaurant was very crowded with a decently long wait, but it was all worth it. I ordered the seasonal omelette (which was Swiss and mushroom). That came with and English muffin and their amazing baked potatoes. It was the perfect portion. Better than that was the house-made Ketchup. If you asked anyone, they know that my least favorite condiment of all time is ketchup, but this stuff is actually amazing.  Above all their cinnamon roll (*one of the greatest things I've ever eaten). This is best split between 3-4 people because the pastry is massive with heaping amounts of cream cheese frosting.  I will definitely be back - one of the best brunches I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. cinnamon roll
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ZiixtUBlP2eJOrX41TPDNw.text: Last day at Pitt as we are packing up to leave for the summer.     Today I have breakfast for the first time   The restaurant opens at 10, there was an amount of people waiting at the door to open, plus there was a vast amount of reserved seats.    So we ordered the cinnamon rolls, the eggs hash and the burger   Amazing food.   This place never fails to amaze me.  Great service and amazing food !!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Breakfast hash
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cinnamon rolls
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Burger

zq6zKiesS7xr0BQjfmPJNg.text: This place was great.  I recently took a busload of college students from OH through Pittsburgh on our way to D.C. for Spring Break.  We had a sit-down reservation for our group of 50 at 11am on a Saturday, and when our bus pulled in at 10:55am, the manager was waiting for us outside, directed us to a (free) parking spot for our bus, and ushered my hungry students inside to three large, waiting tables.  We had a special menu already selected for us and on the table, and the Porch was so organized, it only took two people to serve our entire group.  TWO PEOPLE.  My students were overjoyed with all of the delicious treats (many opted for the kale salad, which they raved over), and no one could resist the cinnamon rolls baked cast iron skillets.    This was a truly wonderful stop for my group.  The restaurant was wonderfully located, easy to access (in spite of nearby construction), and the staff was on top off their game.  I was even able to enjoy a few cocktails at the bar while my students explored downtown a bit after their meal, and let me tell you...their bloody mary's are NOT to be missed (two different types!).    Well done, Pittsburgh.  Well done.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. UC and XU enjoying the Porch at Schenley
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Students from Xavier University (OH)
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Students from the University of Cincinnati (OH)

Q6-o5llU9Or5UAolE7qtpA.text: Excellent food, casual sit down dining, great service. Really enjoyed the salmon, cod, brussel sprouts and calimari.   Right next to a park at Pitt that is lively with activity.   Not a deep menu - a few dish options across entrees, burgers, salads, pizza. Works fine.

vIZU18qv4uzxhcvcjvt6aw.text: spent several hours here with family friends and had a very enjoyable experience! great beers on draft (peach pilsner was soo delicious), and the weekend specials (bolognese, pork shank, and peach cobbler) we delightful! I looked at other people's tables and their food looked very yummy as well! We also had a very nice waiter and a lovely view of the Cathedral of Learning, which for first time tourists like us, was a treat! Would recommend to anyone cisiting Pittsburgh and its colleges!

N58OruMkpwgjXd2VES25NQ.text: I do love the porch. It was the 1st restaurant we went to in Pittsburgh 4 years ago when my son was checking out CMU. We always return every time I visit and Always have a few college kids with us! The menu is fun, the food is always good quality. The location is awesome too! A great little park right outside... sometimes movies playing outside.   My only reason for not giving 5 stars is the staff is hit or miss. Last month 6 of us met there as soon as we finished checking into our hotel... Monday night about 9pm I felt like the staff was really not interested in us. Such as... after driving all day, I would of LOVED to have a glass of wine but the server did not even come over to ask if we wanted a beverage until our whole party was there. 3 of us arrived about 15-20 Minutes before the college kids met us. We were so happy to all be together that it wasn't worth making a fuss over the lack of service.

CgR8gFsm-V6cL_SDGcYQBg.text: After a college tour we came here on a recommendation. Placing your order at counter and having it get delivered to you at a table is operationally smart to the flow of the place but a bit rushed to select something fast, maybe ask questions, etc...? since the line moves quick.  Nice University of Pittsburgh views all around. Pretty comfortable and bright. Decent prices for the quality.  My wife's Smoked Turkey sandwich was phenomenal. My Chicken BLT was good except the grilled chicken (was not burnt) tasted a bit burnt from the grill. The Shrimp Salad that my daughter had was very good.  My favorite item was the "Tots". Delicious seasoned mini potatoes. So perfectly cooked.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken BLT with Tots
Photo of The Porch at Schenley - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cozy Bright Atmosphere

v2Qs8eos7LB88PyrspPMBQ.text: Good food, a bit too pricey. A great deal after 930 on weekdays: half off pizza. Yum.

a9DjLjUlESPAC4ItZH-3VA.text: Excellent experience! We went on a snowy Saturday evening with our 2 1/2-year old in tow. Sat in a relatively uncrowded restaurant, in a cozy and comfortable booth with an amazing view of the Cathedral of Learning. Service and staff were attentive and accommodating. Food was served fast. Almost Arnie cocktail was delisch...Farmbread and smoked wings were yummy...Harvest pie and Margharita pizza were fantastic (2 y/o also cleaned her plate of spaghetti)! Not overly expensive and a big thumbs up for being environmentally friendly. We will definitely be back!

Of1KYt2BlI8ZRckZrUMWZA.text: I had the "Hog special" last night, but it should be called "piglet". The description of pork BBQ, mashed potatoes, grilled fall veggies, etc, sounded delicious, and the meal was good, but TINY. My plate contained about 1 cup of food in total...and it cost $21!. Thank goodness my kids shared their pizza with me or I would have left hungry. I am 5'-5", 120 lbs, so no, I am not a "super-sizer" type....just expect an actual dinner serving for dinner.  Another disappointment: we ordered "gelato" for dessert. They need to drop the fancy label, becasue they are not fooling anyone with what tasted like Giant Eagle store brand icecream.

ZTkTxwNY0_kz3opO812M5g.text: I came here for a beer and a snack one sleepy afternoon and was impressed by the finely crafted interior decoration, but the service really disappointed me. I ordered the fresh cornbread, and it was served ice-cold the first time, and then cold and doughy in the middle the next two times. If you feel like eating cold dough in a nice atmosphere, I recommend The Porch.

6joeq4eMDzj780R68lPh4A.text: The service at PORCH is always great, and the food is very good- they handle groups well! My only issue preventing me from giving this a 4 or 5 star review is that their salads don't come with bread- if you ask for more than a slice of bread (like 2 slices)- they will charge you. For $14-20 a salad, a person dining at this establishment would like to feel that they are eating a properly priced meal, salad greens and dressing do not cost that much, Chef Kev for the love of God give the diners bread.

qMAVPqqLvXYokXjeSkTi8A.text: Good brunch - it wasn't crowded which was probably due to the fact that school was still out of session.  The food & coffee was fresh and the service was decent.  The breakfast potatoes were the best I've ever eaten.  The cinnamon rolls were fine but I would not order them again.  Too much cream cheese-like topping and not enough going on in the rolls themselves, like cinnamon or nuts, etc.

prhU5b6xxtxVxggGQVUoCg.text: I know for a fact it was tough to even get an apology for being served doughy cold pizza and under cooked food that made half our party ill. We can do better Pittsburgh, this is just an overpriced eat n park.

Q-bmNfdtcPANy7ZbjrqwjA.text: I am a native of the 'Burgh who has permanently relocated to Tucson, AZ,  as well as a 4 decade veteran Pitt staff member.   On a visit to Pittsburgh I ate here twice in one day.  Lunch was excellent for a number of reasons and dinner was  better than acceptable, but not nearly as good in concept, amenities and value as lunch.  Do lunch here and dinner somewhere else.

pfUdb0unO__nu6JF1O-L8A.text: Is Ruthann (mentioned in other reviews) the chubby girl with the dyed black hair?  I don't know her name, but she runs the place like a war zone,  Everything is a struggle.  I wanted to order something to eat, but she said I could only order something to drink.  I didn't *want* to order something to drink, but getting her to take my food order was a big deal.  Even when she went to seat me, she insisted on taking the menu from me (I wasn't supposed to carry it myself, apparently) and handing it over only once I sat down.  She is mindlessly combative over every detail.  I went up front to pay (I had been waiting for a while at my table) and--rather than give me a ten dollar bill and let me to go--she made me sit back down (like in the fourth grade) and wait for the waitress to arrive.  Mindless rude and rigid. Really bad social skills.

egXEBIxknKKOSK81QETtSQ.text: Tried it out on opening day - they had lots of staff to help with the ordering process (order when you come in, then get a number and go sit down), the entrees and prices were pretty good, and the food was excellent, especially the potatoes! I think the price is a tiiiiny bit high for Oakland students, but it was really tasty and worth it - and they have a limited but great beer selection (both local and regional beers) as well. Definitely a place I would come for lunch or an after-work drink, and it looks great as well!

1uFgi0mgdlXUIq8Id0tOnQ.text: If you are a people watcher the Porch is for you.  Whether seeing the rich diversity of the local student population or watching the never ending activities outside, you won't be disappointed.                                                Now as far as the food and service goes that can be entertaining also. Watching all the young and usually friendly wait staff bustle about when the place is crowded can be amusing   The food can be as simple as wood oven pizza or ambitious as a seared salmon dinner. Last night my wife and I went  light  I  had  a salad and a delicious bowl of carrot soup. She went for a rare sliced duck that came with a puff pastry stuffed with mushrooms   I got a taste of her plate and everything was good.

KcsWTYGEC4JTY_uurbzbsQ.text: good food,....it all seemed fresh and plated well.  I love the fresh cheese and spices accompanying the pizza.

BfMZFzCiyR8XYmRV-RnGsQ.text: Had a late brunch there with a group of friends on a Sunday. It was the only place without a 30-40 minute wait for 5 people so we gave it a try. The menu is small (but it's brunch so it usually is anywhere you go) but there was variety and the food was great. The atmosphere was really nice. it was a nice day so the side of the restaurant was opened up and we were able to sit inside but still feel like you were outside. You also forgot that you were in the middle of busy Oakland.

se4J-xfgVHSbLMGa0GZHqQ.text: Very very decent. My friend had the burger and I the piggie pizza. I'm a super fan for cured meats so no surprise I loved the prosciutto. Apparently they cure in-house which impressed me. (They train their servers well to sell the place). Best things on the menu need to be the skilet cornbread and the pork belly (but come on it's literally impossible to mess up pork belly). Their beer selection is decent too though not extensive. I'll definitely go back again!

7sySkZKc9TSO2ORiIeR4Bw.text: Start with the strengths:  Roomy interior, nice outdoors porch, upscale creative and  healthy menu that uses lots of fresh ingredients.  We arrived at 5:30 pm on a Saturday evening.  The restaurant wasn't crowded.  It had a nice laid-back vibe and the open "garage doors" let you feel close to the folks on the grass in the park.  Service was friendly and attentive. The weaknesses:  The prices.  I ordered a sangria for $8.00 which was very ordinary.  Too sweet, no fresh fruit to speak of, served in a small glass.  I ordered the green chili with jasmine rice. Very nice flavor, smaller portion, $22.00.  To be honest, for what it was, $12.00 would have been a fair price.  My wife had the quarter chicken.  Again, nice flavor, but in this case the chicken was under cooked (blood coming from the leg-thigh joint).  Seemed very fresh, so I ate it for her, but again, not nearly worth the $18.00 price.   I would recommend this restaurant for its strengths, but I would caution the diner to beware of the prices.  Avoid high-priced specials.  I think we could have had just as nice an experience sharing a pizza and getting the small caesar salads, but it would have been half the $75.00 w/ tip cost.

BOKeN8OYwmylPfK-4hlHRQ.text: The food here is good, the location choice, but the service on the other hand is Neither. Rude waiters ruin the experience,-- Ruthann did so for us.

OvvOQZel1rK6Tral3CXU2g.text: I love love love this restaurant!  The location is great and also love the ambiance.  The restaurant if big, bright, cheerful, a bit noisy but nice noisy, and the servers are always attentive and informative. The food is really good, all of it.  And there is an outside eating option (even in the winter with a lit fireplace!!!). This is a great place to eat alone, with a date, or with a group of people.  The Porch is a much needed and fantastic place to eat in a college area of fast inexpensive food restaurants.

KvQVrCwEK2A0ruSFfnQ-Zw.text: Pretty tasty food.  I have to mark it down a bit because their service was very odd -- at a table of four for lunch, one order came out completely wrong and one came 15-20 minutes later than the other three.  I had the chicken sandwich.  It tasted great, but they slather their bread in so much butter that I'm struggling to remember what the actual filling was like.  Also, despite pushing even further into heart attack territory, I'd recommend getting the fried taters instead of the side salad, since the salad consisted only of lettuce with vinegar.  Not even a tomato.  Worth $9 for lunch?  Not sure.  [update] Got the turkey sandwich my second time.  Came on plain bread, no butter overload!  Much better :)

VTDz5m43mKTP_HpDK-mGMA.text: Disappointed that the staff weren't able to seat a party of ten together. We ended up at a booth and a table, which meant we couldn't talk to each other during the meal. There seemed to be plenty of space in the dining area to put a few tables together. Otherwise, the service was good and the food was fine. We tried the pizza bianca and pizza Margherita, which were well put together and presented. They were out of two of the desserts we wanted (NY cheesecake and pot-de-creme) so we just got coffee and a cappuccino.

XDTHnbAlYaPb-_EbFJ9d6w.text: This place is surprisingly (and wonderfully) unpretentious. First, they very graciously re-seated us in a different area after we asked to be moved due to loud children at a table next to us. Our server, Christopher, was outstanding. He was friendly, but not overbearing and did a good job on even the simple things like keeping water refilled. I have very difficult food intolerances, and Christopher was very patient in listening to my requests and did not act at all put out by the inconvenience. I was expecting a basic salad to arrive to accommodate my requests; however, the chef went the extra mile to cook an amazing dish for me that was delicious and safe for me to eat. To top it off, Christopher gave us some wonderful drink recommendations that we were very happy with. It's nice to see a place that delivers a high quality meal without the pretentious and unaccommodating attitude that it typical of other similar restaurants.

LzjRo2kL3PNkn9XJ3DjtWw.text: Finally, a mid-priced restaurant in Pittsburgh that serves GOOD brunch food! Ambience is fun and seating area is ample. Service is pleasant and atmosphere is casual. Proximity to Pitt and CMU keep it hopping and it can be a bit loud, but those factors are outweighed by the quality of the food. Eggs were a bit greasy, but otherwise delicious.  Parents: my only negative is the very limited kids menu.

q-kErBgxFcjhjqvJN_e_Nw.text: The food is really good, but the service is terrible. Servers rarely come back even to give a water refill and it takes at least 30 min to get your food. If you're willing to wait, however, the food IS delicious. I've been there multiple times and have not received good initial service(initial being by the designated server) once (the last time, we waited for an hour and our waitress came back one time but only shortly after we were seated. They forgot about our order but the manager was very friendly and waived the cost). A lot of Pitt students bring their parents there when they visit -- word of advice: there are a lot of other similar priced places nearby with both food and service that are MUCH better.

-9jXE9VxESK4l8rYcgvaUg.text: Lots of pizzas and salads on the menu, a decent looking wine list, and some nice beers on tap including one offering from East End Brewing Company (Big Hop). There are some nice tables available outside on the "porch" and plenty of indoor seating and a bar. The service was somewhat lacking; they didn't even bring me silverware, and the server seemed to run away when I tried to ask for a napkin.  I tried the asparagus pizza, and crab salad sandwich. Both were decent although not incredible, and the pizza was definitely on the salty side. I'll probably be back, although I wasn't overjoyed with what I had.

SftPrjm8Yj4O0LXI_8TBsw.text: The Porch is one of my favorite casual dining spots in the city.  The food is consistently good, I love a place that uses local produce and has open air seating and a great ambiance.  The only downfall that seems to happen to me more often than not...is incredibly slow service.  Not as frequently at dinner, but every time I stop in and order lunch to go, either I wait 20 minutes for a salad, or someone loses my order etc.  Maybe it's just bad luck, or maybe I always pick the busy days...but if you're in a hurry to get back to the office, this might not be the spot to choose for take out.  If you're dining in and have time to wait and relax...it's perfection!

uArRdPuNIPdyyHzESOWzhA.text: We visited here twice during our Pittsburgh stay. Located smack dab in the middle of the University area. Our first visit was a brunch sponsored by the CMU grad school. Order off the menu brunch. Tasty food, nice views of the square and great wait staff. We went back for lunch a few days latter so we could stroll over to the Cathedral of Learning. While busy, we were able to quickly find seating/ food came out promptly. Good food. Greatplace for people wathcing.

VY_30maEV6aQgEw5va-WBg.text: Came here on a Sunday afternoon with mum and boyfriend after a visit to the Natural History Museum. Immediately I was a bit annoyed by the menu... Options included breakfast items, salads and a few specialty pizzas. Admittedly, I'm a bit picky, so I was getting frustrated trying to find something to eat.   In the meantime, we ordered drinks. I asked for water with a lemon and got a small glass of water with no ice and a bowl of lemons. Ok... so then I ordered a lemonade, which was *awful* - it tasted like fake lemon juice dumped into some water with no sugar. Even dumping a pack of Splenda into it did absolutely nothing. Finally I just asked for a glass of ice and pored my tepid water over that.  The meal got better when we ordered. I asked if it was possible, since they had a smaller size on the kids' menu, that I get a regular pepperoni pizza. So they adjusted the Margarita pizza to have pepperoni on it and went light on the sauce for me without any trouble. It was served on a baking sheet with little piles of dried basil, red pepper flakes and powdered Parmesan on the side and it was very good. Nice thin crust, fire baked and definitely made by hand.    So my experience was OK, and just that. Service was OK, too. Not a bad idea to stop in for a quick bite, but I get the feeling that this place is much better if you're looking for a drink at night or brunch for the morning after.

JLhCfc6s2ezGVpwNKlzIEA.text: Great location and happy hour. Interesting pizzas, salads, sandwiches. Awesome breakfast sandwiches! A little pricey, but not too bad when you consider the venue. A perfect place for lunch in Oakland!

5Pfgo9IRWHN7qM9pKyaM9Q.text: After finishing the Race for the Cure, my friend and I headed over to The Porch to grab some breakfast/brunch.  The menu wasn't that extensive - there was a selection of some breakfast items and then some pizzas from what I recall.    Maybe their menu offering was different since it was Mother's day and on their website, I can't seem to find their "breakfast/brunch" menu.    My friend went with the quiche and I chose the egg sandwich with cheese and it said it had short ribs (but I don't recall any short ribs on the sandwich).  I have to say the sandwich hit the spot, even if it was missing the short ribs.  It was huge!  But I was hungry after the run...my only complaint was that it was missing something - like it needed some other seasoning besides just cheese and eggs...perhaps the short ribs would have made the difference!   The sandwich was served with a side of potatoes, they were little round full potatoes that were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  I really enjoyed them.    I really like the look and feel of this place.  Open, yet comfy!

7rgFPFhDl_0C_4UX4yPDcQ.text: So after reading all the bad reviews for The Porch at Schenley on here, and there are plenty, I was VERY skeptical to try it this weekend. We had friends staying in Oakland for a wedding and we preferred to do brunch in a more traditional brunch spot that we know like Lawrenceviille, downtown, etc. When I heard we were going here I was bummed.   AND BOY WAS I WRONG!!!!!!!!!!!!! Exceptional breakfast. Exceptional. Only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is I felt the menu could have had a few more brunch items like sweet items, pancakes, a French Toast, something. It was pretty much all savory. And they had some basic items that coulda been better.   Basic items  that were off - biscuits. Ordered a side of buttermilk biscuits with apple butter. The biscuits had been run through a toaster. Everyone knows biscuits should be warm and soft, not toasted. But flavor wise they were awesome, and the apple butter was to die for. Several of us at our table had the egg sandwich on rustic farm bread with gruyere. It was to die for. Such good bread. And perhaps the best home fries I've had in Pittsburgh.   Everyone else at our table had the crab eggs benedict and felt it was one of the best eggs bennies they've ever had, loved that the English Muffin appeared home made. My best friend had the biscuits and gravy and was so complimentary on how spicy the gravy was and how it somthered the biscuits just right. My wife ordered the burger with egg on it and her medium burger was SPOT ON. Most Pittsburgh restaurants think medium is this pinkish grey color. This was a textbook medium - hot and red with the blood just starting to run through it. Exceptional burger.   Presentations are great - pork belly served in a cast iron skillet. Old milk bottles served the water. Napkins were a cloth washcloth. Great presentations, exceptional.   Worth the trip. DO IT. You won't regret it. ON the way out we saw the pizzas presented on half pans ( baking sheets ) Killer presentation. KILLER!
